docs.snippet: These whites from the foothills of an active volcano in Sicily are among Italy’s most compelling, and unlike any other whites.

Shares rose in Asia on Friday after technology and consumer-focused stocks led an overnight rally on Wall Street, marking a dramatic end to the market's most volatile quarter in more than two years. Many regional markets were closed for Good Frida...

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Track Tech, Consumer Stocks' Rally on Wall St
headline.main: Asian Shares Track Tech, Consumer Stocks' Rally on Wall St

docs.snippet: A sneak peek at Frenchette in TriBeCa, where Riad Nasr and Lee Hanson will give their Gallic training a fresh spin.

headline.print_headline: A Kitchen Duo for Decades, Now With Their Own Place
headline.main: A Kitchen Duo for Decades, Now With Their Own Place

docs.snippet: Eric Holder, the United States attorney general under President Barack Obama, said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.

headline.main: Eric Holder Speaks With The Times

docs.snippet: A Kenyan opposition politician alleged he was drugged and deported to Dubai early Thursday after his attempt to enter Kenya led to him being detained in an airport toilet for more than a day.

headline.print_headline: Kenyan Opposition Figure Says He Was Drugged and Deported
headline.main: Kenyan Opposition Figure Says He Was Drugged and Deported

docs.snippet: Anita Shreve, the best-selling novelist who explored how women responded to crises past and present in her native New England in favorites such as "The Pilot's Wife," ''Testimony" and "The Weight of Water," has died. She was 71.

headline.print_headline: 'Resistance,' 'The Pilot's Wife' Author Anita Shreve Dies
headline.main: 'Resistance,' 'The Pilot's Wife' Author Anita Shreve Dies

docs.snippet: A Utah man tied up two teenagers, stabbed them to death and dumped their bodies in an abandoned mine shaft before they were reported missing nearly three months ago, police said Thursday.

headline.print_headline: After Bodies Found in Mine, Man Arrested in Teen Deaths
headline.main: After Bodies Found in Mine, Man Arrested in Teen Deaths

docs.snippet: The dispute deepened after a dubious mural was defended by Jeremy Corbyn, the left-wing leader of a party seen in the past as a strong ally of Israel.

headline.print_headline: In Britain, the Labour Party Wrestles With Claims of Anti-Semitism
headline.main: Anti-Semitism Accusations Taint Labour Party, Once Home to U.K.’s Jews

docs.snippet: Wall Street surged on Thursday, bringing an upbeat end to a tumultuous, holiday-shortened week as technology stocks rebounded, but the S&P 500 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average posted their biggest quarterly declines in more than two years.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Stocks Jump in Upbeat End to Tumultuous Quarter
headline.main: U.S. Stocks Jump in Upbeat End to Tumultuous Quarter

docs.snippet: A roundup of some of the most popular but completely untrue headlines of the week. None of these stories is legit, even though they were shared widely on social media. The Associated Press checked these out; here are the real facts:

headline.print_headline: NOT REAL NEWS: A Look at What Didn't Happen This Week
